sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"在思想中形成一个看法或观念"之意。
means: think ： 最普通用词，指想或思索，也指由反复思考而作出判断或得出结论等。
conceive ： 指在头脑中组织好自己的思想，在心中形成一个系统的思想或一个见解。
imagine比conceive更强调形象思维，指在头脑中形成一个清晰明确的意象。
fancy与imagine略不同，往往指的是不切实际的，属于梦幻般的想象。
realize ： 指领悟，通过生动的构思或想象从而抓住事物的本质。

sentence.Network_en: I would imagine she's quite lonely living on her own.
sentence.Network_cn: 我猜想她一个人过肯定很孤独。

sentence.Network_en: I imagine they'll be tearing the building down sooner or later.
sentence.Network_cn: 我猜他们早晚会拆除这座楼的。

sentence.Network_en: Imagine long golden beaches where you can wander in solitude.
sentence.Network_cn: 想象一下那长长的金色海滩吧，在那里你可以独自徜徉。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French imaginer, from Latin imaginare 'form an image of, represent' and imaginari 'picture to oneself', both from imago, imagin- 'image'

encyclopedia.content: 歌词及翻译Imagine 歌手：John Lennon John Lennon Imagine Imagine there's no heaven, 幻想世上并没有天堂 It's easy if you try, 这很容易，只要你试试看 No hell below us, 在我们下面没有地狱 Above us only sky, 在我们上面只有天空 Imagine all the people 想像所有的人 living for today... 都为今天而活 Imagine there's no countries, 想像这世上没有国家 It isn't hard to do, 试试看，这并不难 Nothing to kill or di

entry.def: If you imagine something, you think about it and your mind forms a picture or idea of it.

example.ex: He could not imagine a more peaceful scene...
example.tran: 他想象不出比这更祥和的景象。

example.ex: She couldn't imagine living in a place like that...
example.tran: 她无法想象住在那样一个地方。

entry.def: If you imagine that something is the case, you think that it is the case.

example.ex: I imagine you're referring to Jean-Paul Sartre...
example.tran: 我猜你说的是让－保罗·萨特。

example.ex: We tend to imagine that the Victorians were very prim and proper...
example.tran: 我们往往认为维多利亚时代的人们都一本正经,谨言慎行。

entry.def: If you imagine something, you think that you have seen, heard, or experienced that thing, although actually you have not.

example.ex: I realised that I must have imagined the whole thing.
example.tran: 我意识到大概整件事都是我臆想出来的。

means.word_mean: 1. form a mental image of something that is not present or that is not the case;

sentences.sentence: "Can you conceive of him as the president?"
"I imagine she earned a lot of money with her new novel"
"I thought to find her in a bad state"
"he didn't think to find her in the kitchen"
"I guess she is angry at me for standing her up"

auth_sentence.res_content_con: It is hard to imagine a more likeable heroine.

auth_sentence.res_content: I imagine it as being precarious, yet peaceful.

stems_affixes.word_buile: imagine[v.想象,设想,料想]+able可以……的→adj.可想像到的,可能的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 富有想象力的,爱想象的
stems_affixes.word_buile: imagine[v.想象,设想,料想]+ative表形容词→adj.富有想象力的,爱想象的
imag相象,模仿+ine→v.想象,设想,料想

Sentence.sentence: Imagine the promise: Carrying all your textbooks in a 1.3 pound iPad?
Curmudgeons (倔脾气的人) who imagine that every renter is a murderer can still stay at conventional hotels.
And despite what you may believe about the limits of your own creative imaginations, we all have the potential to imagine the world in an absolutely new way.
You can imagine similar kinds of interactive activities along historical lines," like following the Freedom Trail in Boston, Professor Dede said.
Our brains respond better to difficulty than we imagine
As much as I enjoy my own company, I no longer imagine I can get through a single day much less all my life completely on my own.

sentences.en: I can imagine the scene clearly in my mind.
sentences.cn: 我可以清楚地想像出那个情景。

sentences.en: I cannot imagine what to do in this dreadful situation.
sentences.cn: 我不能想像在这么糟的情况下该怎么办。

sentences.en: I can't imagine lying like that. I would go crazy.
sentences.cn: 我无法想像那样躺着的情形, 我会发疯的。

sentences.en: You don't imagine it is true.
He imagined himself as manager of the company.
sentences.cn: 他把自己想像为公司的经理。

sentences.en: There's nobody following us—you're just imagining it!
sentences.cn: 没有人跟着我们——你只不过是猜想而已。

sentences.en: I don't imagine they will come if it rains.
sentences.cn: 我认为天如果下雨, 他们是不会来的。
他们以为你的船遇难了。

sentences.en: He is always imagining dangers that don't exist.
sentences.cn: 他总是想着那些其实并不存在的危险。

sentences.en: I imagine she was pretty annoyed when she found out.
sentences.cn: 我想她发现此事后一定很生气。

sentences.en: “Does she know what kind of tablets she's taken today?”“I imagine so.
sentences.cn: ”“她知道今天她吃了什么药了吗?”“我想她知道。”

jushi.english: You can little imagine my surprise.
jushi.chinese: 你无法想象我有多么惊奇。

jushi.english: It can be better imagined than described.
jushi.chinese: 与其用词语来描述,还不如用想象力去揣摩。

jushi.english: Hardly had I closed my eyes when I began to imagine the most fantastic.
jushi.chinese: 我刚一合眼,就开始想象一些奇形怪状的东西。
